organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: A Non-invasive Intervention (BreEStim) for Management of Phantom Limb Pain (PLP) After Limb Amputation (Experiment 3)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Non-invasive Intervention (BreEStim) for Management of Phantom Limb Pain (PLP) After Limb Amputation (Experiment 3)

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

collaborators.name: National Institute on Disability, Independent Living, and Rehabilitation Research

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of innovative intervention of breathing controlled electrical stimulation (BreEStim) and conventional electrical stimulation (EStim) in management of neuropathic phantom limb pain in patients after limb amputation after multiple sessions of treatment.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Subjects will receive 10-session BreEStim and 10-session EStim treatment in a random order. The interval between BreEStim and EStim is at least 2 weeks. The following assessment will be made before and after

1. Visual analogue scale (VAS).
2. Quantitative sensory testing (QST). It includes non-invasive assessment of tactile sensation threshold (TST), electrical sensation threshold (EST), electrical pain threshold (EPT), and thermal thresholds.
3. Hear rate variability (HRV). It consists of 5-minute electrocardiogram (ECG) recording before and after a treatment session.

armGroups.label: BreEStim
armGroups.description: BreEStim is voluntary breathing controlled transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation.

armGroups.label: EStim
armGroups.description: EStim is transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation.

interventions.name: BreEStim 240
interventions.description: 240 BreEStim stimuli/visit will be applied for 10 sessions to test any accumulated analgesic effect.

interventions.name: EStim 240
interventions.description: 240 EStim stimuli/visit will be applied for 10 sessions to test any accumulated analgesic effect.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Pain as measured by the visual analog scale (VAS). Scores are recorded from 0 to10.
primaryOutcomes.description: Scores are recorded from 0 to 10 with 0 being "no pain" and 10 being "worst pain."
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, after 10 intervention sessions, about 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in sensation measured by Electrical sensation detection threshold (EDT)
primaryOutcomes.description: This is self-reported by the subjects as soon as they first sense the electrical current.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, after 10 intervention sessions, about 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in pain measured by Electrical pain detection threshold (EPT)
primaryOutcomes.description: This is self-reported by the subjects at the first sensation of pain.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, after 10 intervention sessions, about 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Heart Rate Variability (HRV) measured by electrocardiogram (ECG)
primaryOutcomes.description: HRV is a measure of the variation in time between each heartbeat. We use HRV to identify the autonomic nervous system changes after intervention treatment.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline, after 10 intervention sessions, about 2 weeks

overallOfficials.name: Sheng Li, MD, PhD
